summary:
As a business and CX transformation expert, my mission is to empower companies to build a sustainable, customer-centric future. To achieve this, I blend expertise in consumer psychology and behaviour with the best change management practices. 

I believe in both the power of stories to energize us and of sound research to show us the way forward. Hence, I strive to share the stories I've encountered and sound evidence-based advice from academic research. 

My interests in consumer psychology and customer experience have culminated in the publication of two books: "The New Customer Experience Management" (https://t.ly/-2xa6) and "The Abusive Customer" (https://t.ly/YYa6J). 

Personally, I'm passionate about photography and I'm a devoted runner, with multiple half-marathons, a couple of full ones, and an ultra-marathon under my belt.

I also had the honour of being a mentor in the second season of the Mentor the Young program (https://www.mentortheyoung.com/), supporting the development of bright young professionals. 

Let's connect over a cup of coffee and chat about transforming customer experience together.

[{'url': 'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0BB8DJWG5/ref=tsm_1_fb_lk', 'title': "The New Customer Experience Management: Why and How the Companies of the Future Address Their Customers' Needs Proactively", 'description': "The leaders in CX don't disengage from their customers once they've sold the product or the service - they stay with them to help them create value.

The leaders in CX don't wait for something to happen - they are proactive.

The leaders in CX don't offer one-size-fits-all solutions - they personalize them.
